pull.title: build: Restrict check for CRC32C intrinsic to aarch64
pull.body:
`crc32c`'s hardware accelerated code doesn't handle ARM 32-bit at all, but only 64-bit. Make the check in `configure.ac` check for this architecture explicitly. This change does not affect non-ARM architectures.

For the release binaries, the current `configure.ac` check happens to work: it enables it on aarch64 but disables it for armhf. However some combination of compiler version and settings can cause this check to succeed on armhf (as reported on IRC). So make the 64-bit platform requirement explicit.

(details: while the check already explicitly checks the `__crc32d` intrinsic, which strictly doesn't exist on 32-bit ARM, this is not enough! gcc happens to helpfully emulate it:
> These built-in intrinsics for the ARMv8-A CRC32 extension are available when the -march=armv8-a+crc switch is used "uint32_t __crc32d (uint32_t, uint64_t)" Form of expected instruction(s): Two crc32w r0, r0, r0 instructions for AArch32

)

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

events.body: ARM "emulates" it with two crc32w from what you said on IRC. But is that actually slower than the fallback non-assembly code? If it performs better, maybe we'd be better off making it work (as it apparently did in 0.21)

Tested the GUIX build:
```
$ aarch64-linux-gnu-objdump -d 64/bitcoin-f6a7ed55c9bc/bin/bitcoind |grep crc32 | wc
    136     816    5341
$ arm-linux-gnueabihf-objdump -d 32/bitcoin-f6a7ed55c9bc/bin/bitcoind |grep crc32 | wc
      0       0       0
```

> ARM "emulates" it with two crc32w from what you said on IRC. But is that actually slower than the fallback non-assembly code? If it performs better, maybe we'd be better off making it work (as it apparently did in 0.21)

No, it can never have worked like this. I'm obviously fine with someone adapting crc32c's hardware acceleration to work on 32-bit ARM, but be aware that 32-bit hardware with support for CRC32C is exceedingly rare. It's probably why Google didn't bother.

Until then this is the fix to make it at least not crash.
tACK f6a7ed55c9bc16fcf48d3d4b957170f12393049e (also ACK AArch64 rename variant thereof)

events.message:
build: Restrict check for CRC32C intrinsic to aarch64

`crc32c`'s hardware accelerated code doesn't handle ARM 32-bit at all.
Make the check in `configure.ac` check for this architecture explicitly.

For the release binaries, the current `configure.ac` check happens
to work: it enables it on aarch64 but disables it for armhf. However
some combination of compiler version and settings might ostensibly cause
this check to succeed on armhf (as reported on IRC). So make the 64-bit
platform requirement explicit.

ACK f2747d1602ec4e1128356b861b2167daf66a845b

Not to familiar with the inner workings here, but I read up a bit on this. Additionally, I ran a GUIX build successfully on this PR branch, and subsequently tested the ARM binary on a 32-bit beaglebone by running `bitcoind`.

GUIX hashes:
```
$ env HOSTS='arm-linux-gnueabihf aarch64-linux-gnu' ./contrib/guix/guix-build
$ find guix-build-$(git rev-parse --short=12 HEAD)/output/ -type f -print0 | env LC_ALL=C sort -z | xargs -r0 sha256sum
```

issue.title: [4.22.x] Backports for 4.22.x
issue.body:
9d77d50cba866759b3186eb447d78863a60b34f9 qt: Avoid crash on startup if int specified in settings.json
c6edd55adb269182671aaae5567f6bafad801a49 fs: Make compatible with boost 1.78
3880990cb328d3544bb3cd73a887e46e2a63dc8b test: Call ceildiv helper with integer (Martin Zumsande)
54b8bc34038ba23c379e6ac2feaa18ef763a545d ci: Replace soon EOL hirsute with jammy (MarcoFalke)
9c17ab4e516af7001367eca91e45284344f64e33 build: patch qt to explicitly define previously implicit header include (Kittywhiskers Van Gogh)
158b842eda81d5c0f8d1041dd6e488f1fc1beffc tests: Calculate fees more similarly to CFeeRate::GetFee (Andrew Chow)
6489fa73353b78c4c8b3dd7517133ae9c1f99dd6 tests: Test for assertion when feerate is rounded down (Andrew Chow)
9c25bfabad2bdaee3ce28a97960f6946456e3d1d fees: Always round up fee calculated from a feerate (Andrew Chow)
f1b43aeeb40e880fceed16dc9242b042688dcbf2 wallet: fix segfault by avoiding invalid default-ctored `external_spk_managers` entry (Sebastian Falbesoner)
3e67e4713c379e3e650a0907cc4e124f7a1292e7 refactor: include a missing <limits> header in fs.cpp (Joan Karadimov)
fa41ac3f154fab62939185ad484f89ec80dcd49e consensus: don't call GetBlockPos in ReadBlockFromDisk without lock (Jon Atack)
40fc9f71755a27419536d43b6129349302191421 the result of CWallet::IsHDEnabled() was initialized with true. (Saibato)
4ef0906c23f72d448b57b5836da37a30807f2450 build, qt: Fix typo in QtInputSupport check (Hennadii Stepanov)
59bdf4b457a57630ac58d808886db473dba876d7 system: skip trying to set the locale on NetBSD (fanquake)
1a0212f13f710e3234f3cbb8690e25bfe2e29e39 guix: Fix powerpc64(le) dynamic linker name (Carl Dong)
3210c0773c6cab9bb8223fd5f72d0f107a31dc6e doc: Add 23061 release notes (MarcoFalke)
6c37a435a6af7e67d2574bf2440b6e21bc253666 Fix (inverse) meaning of -persistmempool (MarcoFalke)
4466956cf2a2bb9193c2e19c373ac59cd47dc518 build: Restrict check for CRC32C intrinsic to aarch64 (W. J. van der Laan)

issue.title: 0.21 Backports
issue.body:
There might not be another 0.21.x release, however these are both straight forward changes. If this isn't merged, then the pulls can remain untagged for needing backport.

Backports:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23045
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23335

events.body: Maybe! If they have the same check, and haven't actually fixed ARM32 support, they'll have the same problem.

issue.title: build: Restrict check for CRC32C intrinsic to aarch64
issue.body:
> `crc32c`'s hardware accelerated code doesn't handle ARM 32-bit at all, but only 64-bit. Make the check in `configure.ac` check for this architecture explicitly. This change does not affect non-ARM architectures.
> 
> For the release binaries, the current `configure.ac` check happens to work: it enables it on aarch64 but disables it for armhf. However some combination of compiler version and settings can cause this check to succeed on armhf (as reported on IRC). So make the 64-bit platform requirement explicit.
> 
> (details: while the check already explicitly checks the `__crc32d` intrinsic, which strictly doesn't exist on 32-bit ARM, this is not enough! gcc happens to helpfully emulate it:
> 
> > These built-in intrinsics for the ARMv8-A CRC32 extension are available when the -march=armv8-a+crc switch is used "uint32_t __crc32d (uint32_t, uint64_t)" Form of expected instruction(s): Two crc32w r0, r0, r0 instructions for AArch32
> 

Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23045

events.body:
> Should it be submitted to the [upstream](https://github.com/google/crc32c/blob/21fc8ef30415a635e7351ffa0e5d5367943d4a94/CMakeLists.txt#L147-L156)?

> Maybe! If they have the same check, and haven't actually fixed ARM32 support, they'll have the same problem.

Done in https://github.com/google/crc32c/pull/61.

issue.title: DigiByte Core ( BTC22.1 Backports for BTC Core 22  )
issue.body:
Fixes Included:
[build: Restrict check for CRC32C intrinsic to aarch64 #23045](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23045)
[Fix (inverse) meaning of -persistmempool #23061](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23061)
[build: Fix guix linker-loader path and add check_ELF_interpreter #23148](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23148)
[system: skip trying to set the locale on NetBSD #22390](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22390)
[build, qt: Fix typo in QtInputSupport check #22820](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22820)
[wallet: fix the behavior of IsHDEnabled, return false in case of a blank hd wallet. #22781](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22781)
[consensus: don't call GetBlockPos in ReadBlockFromDisk without cs_main lock #22895](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22895)
[refactor: include a missing <limits> header in fs.cpp #23335](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23335)
[wallet: fix segfault by avoiding invalid default-ctored external_spk_managers entry #23333](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23333)
[build: patch qt to explicitly define previously implicit header include  #23580](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23580)
[ci: Replace soon EOL hirsute with jammy #23504](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23504)
[test: fix ceildiv division by using integers #24239](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24239)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -568,13 +568,17 @@ AX_CHECK_COMPILE_FLAG([-march=armv8-a+crc+crypto],[[ARM_CRC_CXXFLAGS="-march=arm
 
 TEMP_CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS"
 CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS $ARM_CRC_CXXFLAGS"
-AC_MSG_CHECKING(for ARM CRC32 intrinsics)
+AC_MSG_CHECKING(for ARM64 CRC32 intrinsics)
comments.body: nit: AArch64 is a more accurate name, since it's not really related to the 32-bit ARM architecture AIUI.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -568,13 +568,17 @@ AX_CHECK_COMPILE_FLAG([-march=armv8-a+crc+crypto],[[ARM_CRC_CXXFLAGS="-march=arm
 
 TEMP_CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS"
 CXXFLAGS="$CXXFLAGS $ARM_CRC_CXXFLAGS"
-AC_MSG_CHECKING(for ARM CRC32 intrinsics)
+AC_MSG_CHECKING(for ARM64 CRC32 intrinsics)
comments.body: Sure, fine with changing the name, though what crc32c library uses internally is ARM64 so I mimiced that.
